title: Confusing Error Message on Closure Argument Lifetimes

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

body:
Hi all, I am getting a confusing error message when omitting the types of the arguments of a closure. This may be somewhere in between of a bug and a diagnostics issue, but I am not brave enough to suggest that the compiler should make a different decision here. :)

Given the following code: [playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=eedb8aa7428053e5108270963ea72e59)

```rust
use std::collections::BTreeMap;

fn my_retain(map: &mut BTreeMap<i32, i32>, pred: impl Fn(&i32) -> bool) {
    let pred_better = |_, val: &mut i32| {
        pred(val)
    };
    map.retain(pred_better);
}

fn main() {}
```

The current output is:

```
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[[E0308]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0308): mismatched types
   [--> src/main.rs:7:15
](https://play.rust-lang.org/#)    |
7   |     mapperoni.retain(pred_better);
    |               ^^^^^^ lifetime mismatch
    |
    = note: expected type `FnOnce<(&i32, &mut i32)>`
               found type `for<'r> FnOnce<(&i32, &'r mut i32)>`
note: this closure does not fulfill the lifetime requirements
   [--> src/main.rs:4:23
](https://play.rust-lang.org/#)    |
4   |       let pred_better = |_, val: &mut i32| {
    |  _______________________^
5   | |         pred(val)
6   | |     };
    | |_____^
note: the lifetime requirement is introduced here
   --> /home/me/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/alloc/src/collections/btree/map.rs:977:33
    |
977 |         F: FnMut(&K, &mut V) -> bool,
    |                                 ^^^^

```
This is not very helpful, because the last `note` section doesn't point to a lifetime, it points to a bool. It probably means that &K and &mut V have elided lifetimes that should match, and the compiler had not decided to give the `pred_better` closure matching argument lifetimes.

Ideally the output should look like:

```
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[[E0308]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0308): mismatched types
   [--> src/main.rs:7:15
](https://play.rust-lang.org/#)    |
7   |     mapperoni.retain(pred_better);
    |               ^^^^^^ lifetime mismatch
    |
    = note: expected type `FnOnce<(&i32, &mut i32)>`
               found type `for<'r> FnOnce<(&i32, &'r mut i32)>`
note: this closure does not fulfill the lifetime requirements, because you have not specified the second argument of the closure to be of type `&i32`, and therefore lifetime elision has not decided that the lifetimes of the closure should be the same.
help: consider specifying the argument types of the closure: |_: &i32, val: &mut i32|
```

I also think that maybe the compiler should infer what the correct lifetimes should be, since it can look at the definition of `BTreeMap::<i32, i32>::retain`, but I am not sure what the way forward is.

Behaviour happens with both nightly and stable
